definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
nothing for nothing/you get what you pay for
pinyin: yi1 fen1 qian2 yi1 fen1 huo4
yi1 fen1 qian2 liang3 fen1 huo4

sentences.english: I got bupkis for my bonus.
sentences.chinese: 我一分钱奖金也没拿到。

sentences.english: Smile the most is the wisdom of goods does not spend a single penny for advertising.
sentences.chinese: 微笑最高明之处就是不花一分钱为商品做广告。

sentences.english: I have one cent, he said. It is an American coin.
sentences.chinese: 他心想，我有一分钱呢，一枚美元硬币。

sentences.english: Her mother used to keep track of every penny she spent.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲从前把自己所花的每一分钱都记下来。

sentences.english: But there is fierce competition for each movie dollar.
sentences.chinese: 但是，影片的每分钱都竞争非常激剧。

sentences.english: He turned all his pockets inside out but found no cent whatever.
sentences.chinese: 他把所有口袋都翻了出来，但一分钱都没找到。

sentences.english: No one is a hero in the plight.
A man money is no man at all.
Bill is such a penny pincher . He never gives a cent to charity.
sentences.chinese: 比尔是个吝啬鬼，从未为慈善事业捐过一分钱。

sentences.english: But still, you get what you pay for, as the price always reflects the quality.
sentences.chinese: 不过，一分钱一分货，价格总是能够反映质量。

sentences.english: He wanted to nickel me up for another hot dog.
sentences.chinese: 他想花5分钱让我再给他一个“热狗”吃。

sentences.english: The salesman won't bate a penny of it.
sentences.chinese: 售货员一分钱也不肯减少。

sentences.english: I didn't get any money, but my molar is wrapped in gauze.
sentences.chinese: 我一分钱都没得到，但我的大牙却给纱布包起来了。

sentences.english: "A penny for your thoughts," I said.
sentences.chinese: 给你一分钱，告诉我你在想什么？

sentences.english: Without money, even a hero will be driven against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 一分钱也能难倒英雄汉。

sentences.english: Some online shop owners have admitted they have never paid taxes before.
sentences.chinese: 据悉，有些店主承认，过去从未交过一分钱的税款。

definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
to struggle to get free/to strive to acquire/to make (money)
to buy or sell on credit/outstanding account/to have an outstanding account
one yuan or less/around 80 cents or one dollar
high denomination of banknotes or coins/lots of money/a big sum (e.g. a bribe)
